intro: Calonyction setosum, commonly known as the spiny flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems covered in stiff, bristly hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Calonyction setosum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
